title: (x) Trek logo - similar to Rockwell {Mike Y}
author: anonymous

comments.content: I think [Rockwell Extra Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031203241/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/rockwell-mt-2/rockwell-extra-bold/testdrive.html) would be the sort of starting point James suggested. The letterforms are fairly close, and a little outline editing of serif shapes and stroke intersections on the R could finish the job.
Thanks for your help. I'll give it a try.

This is likely customed designed, like the logos for most major corporations. As for a close alternative, I'm not sure. Perhaps another typophile can suggest something based on the logo that's been unobliqued and recompressed. That may be a good starting point. I hope this help somwhat.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031203241im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/48652.gif)
